Approximately 9: of the American Rescue Plan funding is allocated for direct COVID-19 intervention, including vaccines and testing.
The majority of the funding: around 85%, is designated for pandemic relief, which includes $1,400 stimulus payments, expanded unemployment benefits, school aid, and other specific earmarks.
The bill also includes provisions unrela: such as a minimum wage increase, pension reform, and local transportation projects.
Around 15: of the proposal is allocated to "long-standing policy priorities that are not directly related to the current crisis," according to the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget.
